modules.description: Sets up a metrics reporter that generates output in the specified format (image, script, or datafile) to the given directory. It configures where and how metric data is written, enabling visualization or logging through Gnuplot-backed outputs. This is useful when integrating metric collection into applications that require on-disk artifacts for analysis or reporting.

This module provides functions to monitor and control garbage collection statistics in OCaml. It uses a background thread to periodically collect GC data using `Gc.quick_stats` or `Gc.stats`, at intervals specified by the user. It is useful for profiling memory usage and tuning performance in long-running applications like servers or data processing pipelines.
